Authors:
Ana Lucia Jesus, Gustavo Henrique Jeronimo, Carmen Lidia
Amorim Pires-Zottarelli
Title:
Two new species of Chytriomycetaceae: morphological,
phylogenetic and ultrastructural characterization
Keywords:
flagellar plug, paracrystalline inclusion, taxonomy,
zoospore ultrastructure, 2 new taxa
Abstract:
Systematics of Chytridiales has been deeply influenced by
analyses of molecular loci and zoospore ultrastructure. Even though the
Chytridiales is the largest order within Chytridiomycota, Brazilian
isolates of this clade have been poorly integrated. Here, we isolated
seven species and documented their morphology, including zoospore
ultrastructure for one species?, and phylogenetic positions for all
based on analyses of nuc 18S rDNA (18S), nuc rDNA ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 (ITS),
and nuc 28S rDNA (28S). Phylogenetic results support the placement of
five species among the Asterophlyctaceae, Chytriomycetaceae, and
Chytridiaceae, and two species of uncertain position within the
Chytridiales. Two species of Chytriomycetaceae are described as new,
Rhizidium crepaturum and Siphonaria aurea, and Rodmanochytrium
sphaericum is recorded for the first time from Brazil.
